meanings.definition: to fill the joints of masonry with small stones or pebbles
meanings.sent1: The workers were galleting the wall to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The mason spent the day galleting the bricks together.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was galleting acorns into the gaps between the fence posts.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter galleted through the silent room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the waves galleting against the shore was soothing.

meanings.definition: the act of filling joints with small stones or pebbles
meanings.sent1: The galleting of the stones was meticulous work.
meanings.sent2: He learned the art of galleting from his grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The galleting in the garden gave it a unique and rustic look.
meanings.sent4: The galleting of memories in her mind created a beautiful mosaic of experiences.
meanings.sent5: The galleting of colors in the painting added depth and texture.
